intro: Hibbertia huegelii, commonly known as the orange hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Hibbertia huegelii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
